definition: to miss/to leave out/to omit/to be omitted/to be missing/to slip through/to leak out/to seep away
to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: But a focus exclusively on majors and job openings misses two key points.
sentences.chinese: 专门着眼于专业和职位的空缺漏掉了两个关键点。

sentences.english: Do you know about other interesting shortcuts which I may have missed ?
sentences.chinese: 你还知道另外一些有趣的我可能漏掉的快捷键吗？

sentences.english: You only missed the freesia and the roses.
sentences.chinese: 你只漏掉了鸢尾草和玫瑰。

sentences.english: Its an interesting article but misses one big thing.
sentences.chinese: 好精彩的文章，可惜漏掉了一个重点。

sentences.english: Don't leave out the definite article.
Women remember everything, and they will never, ever let an issue die.
sentences.chinese: 女人则记得每一件事，她们从不让一件小事漏掉。

sentences.english: With so many words said I forget the pop music.
sentences.chinese: 说来说去，我把流行音乐漏掉了。

sentences.english: But in the morass of all this minutiae, we seem to be missing the point.
sentences.chinese: 但在一切细节的沼泽中，我们似乎漏掉了一点。

sentences.english: The results showed that the hearts of the mutated mice skipped beats intermittently.
sentences.chinese: 结果显示，基因突变小鼠的心脏会间歇性的漏掉一拍。

sentences.english: It's obvious that one sling was missed out by your tallyman .
sentences.chinese: 很明显有一勾被你们的理货员漏掉了。

sentences.english: I didn't want to get in a hurry and leave out information.
sentences.chinese: 我也愿意这样，因为我不愿匆忙之间漏掉有关的信息。

sentences.english: Oil and gas layers may often be omitted according to traditional base and procedure to choose layer location before production testing.
sentences.chinese: 传统的试油层位选层依据和程序易漏掉油气层。

sentences.english: Well, my boy, what were the books which were forgotten?
sentences.chinese: 好的，孩子，是哪几本书漏掉了？

sentences.english: I opened my eyes as large as possible, fearing to lose anything.
sentences.chinese: 我尽量睁大眼睛，生怕会漏掉什么。

sentences.english: Pooter's name had been omitted from the list of the guests…
sentences.chinese: 普特尔的名字被从客人名单中漏掉了。

sentences.english: In his early samples, George drops subjects about 40% of the time.
sentences.chinese: 在早期范例中，乔治漏掉主词占40%。

definition: to slip/to overlook by negligence/careless omission/oversight
to err/to get sth wrong/to miscalculate/to misunderstand
to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
lit. spider's thread and horse track/tiny hints (of a secret)/traces/clue
